result.execSummary:
The defendant Gilbert Montrell Carothers was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Gilbert Montrell Carothers is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Gilbert Montrell Carothers was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent to current probation.
Court dismisses Count 1.
Court reads-in and dismisses 15CM310 for restitution purposes.
Defendant to report to Probation by 9:00 a.m. February 24, 2016.
Bond continues in form and amount until Defendant reports to Probation.
Probation can be terminated earlier if Defendant satisfies all conditions and with a recommendation from Agent.
Court notes 1 day credit against ultimate sentence.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with: current probation

records.addlTxt: Reason for Change: Deceased.           Restitution = $135.84, Court Obs $456.58 and Supv fees = $560.00. eif
E: DOC. eif
c: Def, Atty, DA, Baldwin PD, Jail & E: Probation. eif
signed by Def & Atty this date. eif

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Megan E. Kelly DF ATTY: Joseph Robert Caton DF: Gilbert Montrell Carothers appeared. Case called at 15CM310, 15CM618. ADA Kelly updates the court. Atty. Caton agrees.   Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 2 in 15CM618. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 2 in 15CM618. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 1 in 15CM618 and read in and dismiss 15CM310 for purposes of restitution. Sentencing arguments. DE makes a statement. Crt orders: 
On 15CM618 -Sentence I/S 90 Days St. Croix County Jail. Court authorizes huber.
1 year probation with conditions: 
Probation can be terminiated earlier if DE satisfies all of his conditions of his bond and with a recommendation by agent. 
1 day credit against any ultimate sentence probation to run concurrent to current probation. 
- AODA and any recommended follow through. 
- 40 hours community service
- pay restitution on case 15CM310 of $135.84. 
- DE to have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, K.VanSomeren Thorton.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent. 
- DE to complete a victim impact panel
- Costs
- DE to make responable efforts to obtain GED or HSED. 
- Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.

On 15CM310
- restitution of $135.84.
 
DE to report to probation by 9:00am on 02-24-2016.
Bond continues in form and amount until DE reports to probation.
Paper file also. km
